Text:
Yes, destroying the Templars could actually lead to
the Cult growing stronger.

No, we should work under the assumption that it will
happen.

The Cult is working in countries all over the world,
so it really must want that right of inquisition,
which can be used against governments.

Which means that, once the Templars are gone and the
right has no claimant, the Cult will grab it, because
there is no other power to stand in their way.
Well, what should we do then, Lady Alpha?

I want you all to think of the time that Shadow
saved you.

We were rotting away in a pit of despair, and Shadow
pulled us out.

Has Shadow abandoned a single possessed he's found
to die, even once?

And so the Shadow Garden, an extension of his will,
cannot ignore those wishes when we move.

So as a group, any decision that would abandon any
possessed that we could possibly save is out
of the question.

Those lives we save, the lives we must save, are every
bit as valuable as our own.
Lady Alpha!

You're right, Master Shadow being that way is
exactly why we are alive today.

The fact that the Templars keep the Cult in check is
no reason for us to ignore the possessed that they
continue to kill.

If it puts the life of a single possessed at risk,
even if we do end up helping our enemies,
the Cult.

Yeah...if Master Shadow were here, we know what he
would do.

I don't want to go weighing lives, but I guess the
Templars, who execute the possessed on sight,
make them the greater threat those we want
to save.

The Shadow Garden's reason for being is to work from
the shadows to counter the Cult's agenda for the world.

But it is every bit as important to preserve the
lives of our fellows who bear the blood of
heroes as it is to save the world from secret
domination.

We will not pay for our agenda with the blood of
others. We are better than the Cult of Diablos!
It's decided, then.

We will strike the Templars from the shadows to save
the possessed from future danger!

It would be best if, in the process, we could also
act against the Cult of Diablos, as well.

Like Zeta says, our priority is to save the possessed,
but we also need to find what advantages we can
in this.

Eliminating a major Church organization like that
should stand in the way of the Cult's dark deeds,
since it is working under Church authority.

And as the Cult's influence in the Church grows,
overall action against the possessed seems to be
slowing.

The Shadow Garden will destroy the Templars!
Once and for all!

In that case, we need to quickly draw their
attention.

If we divert their attention, that should help slow
them down from discovering and killing any
more possessed.

So the Seven Shadows are going to put on a show.
Is that right, Lady Alpha?
It's time to get ready for a showdown!
